```{r, echo = FALSE, results = "hide"}
speed <- sample(10:100, 1) # m/s
freq <- sample(10:100, 1) # Hz
  
ans <- signif(speed / freq, 3) # freq (m)
dis <- c(speed * freq)

sc <- num_to_schoice(ans, wrong = dis, delta = ans/10, format = FALSE, digits = 6)
sc$questions <- sprintf("$%g \\,\\mathsf{m}$", signif(sc$questions, 3))
```
Question
========
A wave has a frequency of $`r freq` \,\mathsf{Hz}$ and a speed of $`r speed` \,\mathsf{m/s}$.
What is its wavelength?

```{r, echo = FALSE, results = "asis"}
answerlist(sc$questions, markup = "markdown")
```

Solution
========
Wave speed is wavelength times frequency ($v = \lambda f$). Therefore,

$$ \lambda = \frac{v}{f} = \frac{`r speed` \,\mathsf{m/s}}{`r freq` \,\mathsf{Hz}} = `r ans` \,\mathsf{m}$$
